meanings.definition: A glass case used for displaying valuable or important objects.
meanings.sent1: The showcase in the museum held ancient artifacts.
meanings.sent2: The jewelry store had a beautiful showcase filled with diamonds.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat knocked over the showcase, causing a commotion.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled like the glass of a showcase, full of wonder and curiosity.
meanings.sent5: The showcase gleamed under the spotlight, drawing everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: To exhibit or display something prominently.
meanings.sent1: During the event, they will showcase their latest products.
meanings.sent2: The artist will showcase her paintings at the gallery next week.
meanings.sent3: The magician decided to showcase his skills at the children's party.
meanings.sent4: The chef will showcase his culinary expertise in the cooking competition.
meanings.sent5: The fashion show will showcase the latest trends in clothing design.

meanings.definition: A display or demonstration of a particular skill or talent.
meanings.sent1: The dance recital was a showcase of the students' hard work.
meanings.sent2: The talent show was a great showcase of the community's abilities.
meanings.sent3: The comedy act turned into a showcase of hilarious mishaps.
meanings.sent4: Her speech was a showcase of eloquence and passion.
meanings.sent5: The art exhibition was a vibrant showcase of creativity and talent.
